Authors: Heryadi Y., Robbany A.Z., Sudarma H.
Title: User experience evaluation of virtual reality-based cultural gamification using GameFlow approach
Source title: 2016 1st International Conference on Game, Game Art, and Gamification, ICGGAG 2016
Affiliations: GameLab, Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Heryadi, Y., GameLab, Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia; Robbany, A.Z., GameLab, Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia; Sudarma, H., GameLab, Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper presents some empiric results on the effect of some game player profiles to their user experience. The cultural gamification prototype for this study is developed using Virtual Reality technology on Google Cardboard in which some elements of Indonesian culture is used in part of the game story. Dataset for the game evaluation is collected using survey method. Data collection is implemented using self-administered questionnaire which is developed based on GameFlow framework. The respondent population is the college students who like to play games. The survey samples are chosen using purposive sampling technique. The results of this study indicate that there is a strong association of playing frequency and personality traits to game user experiences. Also, there is a weak association between gender and age to game user experiences. These research findings are valuable for game designer to design enjoyable and educational games. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cultural Gamification; GameFlow; User Experience Evaluation
Index Keywords: Students; Virtual reality; Educational game; Gameflow; Gamification; Personality traits; Sampling technique; Self-administered questionnaire; User experience evaluations; Virtual reality technology; Surveys; Design; Evaluation

Authors: Chong H., Ariandy F., Sudarma H.
Title: Diva: Development and integration of file sharing application in android platform
Source title: International Review on Computers and Software
Authors with affiliations: Chong, H., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Ariandy, F., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sudarma, H., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The research aims to develop a file sharing application based on Android, which is integrated with desktop application on intranet network. The research method proposes an interview and observation of the prevalent system. The software development life cycle, applied to this research has posed an incremental model. The outcome of the research delineated a file sharing android application integrated with the desktop application. There is a ubiquitous file sharing application. However, the customization of integrated file sharing in android application with the contemporary application on intranet particularly is inaccessible on the market. Therefore, the DIVA is proposed as a possible solution. © 2016 Praise Worthy Prize S.r.l. - All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Desktop; File sharing application; Integrated android application; Mobile communication apps

Authors: Chong H., Sudarma H., Luwinda F.A., Faahakhododo I., Gaol F.L.
Title: Wirest lang lab: Mobile platform language laboratory based on REST Web Service
Affiliations: Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chong, H., Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Sudarma, H., Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Faahakhododo, I., Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Problem statement: Language Lab plays crucial role in learning foreign language. With its capability to create environment of connecting students with students, connecting student with teacher and giving the impactful learning resources, some of institution are dare to invest of expensive system. Hence, some of them keep searching for more efficient way to learning language. In this study, based on the previous research of REST Web Service as open content, proposed a Mobile Platform Based Language Laboratory on Web Service. With this idea, hopefully, a more fun language learning mobile environment can be created in the future. © 2014 H. Chong et al.
Author Keywords: Language laboratory; Mobile platform; REST; Web service
